Key Match Events: Kevin De Bruyne sealed the win with a late goal
Romania went close with a header by Radu Dragusin that was saved well
Dodi Lukebakio's fierce shot was well saved by Florin Nita after a trademark carving run by De Bruyne
Lukebakio and Amadou Onana both blazed over when free in front of goal
Post-Match Reflections: Belgium manager Domenico Tedesco said the result was good and that Romania left more space than Slovakia did
Romania coach Edward Iordanescu said they need solidarity and unity and that a third goal would have been really bad for them
Miscellaneous Highlights: The only mystery was how there were only two goals in the game
For the first time in European Championship history, all four teams in a group are on equal points after two rounds
The game was played in an astonishing atmosphere in Cologne
